prs.title: node: Extend flow cancel by configuring allow-list of chain ID pairs ("corridors")
prs.truncated_body:
- Add a concept of "corridors" which consist of a pair of chains
- Add field in the Governer that enables flow cancel only for corridors
  which are explicitly enabled
- Set the Eth-Sui corridor as the only flow cancel-enabled pair. Sui is the
  only chain with frequent governor congestion so it is the only one
  that really needs the Flow Cancel capabilities. Ethereum is the main
  chain th

commits.message:
node: Add ability to limit Flow Cancel to pairs of chains

- Add a concept of "pipes" which consist of a pair of chains
- Add field in the Governer that enables flow cancel only for "pipes"
  which are explicitly enabled
- Set the Eth-Sui pipe as the only flow cancel-enabled pair. Sui is the
  only chain with frequent governor congestion so it is the only one
  that really needs the Flow Cancel capabilities. Ethereum is the main
  chain that Sui is interacting with in terms of volume moving in and
  out of Sui.
- Refactor calling sites for flow cancel transfer functions so that all
  checks are done in one place. (Should help prevent bugs where only one
  calling site is updated.)
node: Call pipe.valid() when adding a flow cancel transfer

node: Add unit tests for Governor pipes. Modify pipe equality check

- Add unit tests to ensure that the flow cancel feature works iff valid
  pipes are configured
- Adds unit tests for the pipe type (validity, equality between two
  pipes)
- Modifies pipe.equals() to always return false for invalid pipes
Restore continue on error. Improve comments and error messages
Remove redundant validity check, add comment
Add unit test for mainnet deployment of flow cancel pipes
Remove continue statement when flow cancel returns error
Improve unit test coverage for pipes
re-order error checking; avoid early return if flow cancel fails

prs.title: dedupe modules with same hash when computing graph.
prs.truncated_body:
same module would be executed multiple times if it is used at multiple places in the graph under different names.

* shortest name will be used as canonical
* `substreams info` correctly shows the stages without duplicates.
  - if used with `--used-modules-only`, a single copy of each module is shown.
* prevents writing the same output files multiple times

commits.message: dedupe modules with same hash when computing graph. shortest name is used as canonical
write mapper outputs in a streaming fashion to prevent RAM usage bursts

prs.truncated_body: tx sender is currently not thread-safe because of the global config. This PR adds overloads to the main function where you can supply your own config

prs.title: chore(pectra): StateDB metrics
prs.truncated_body:
New metric key:
- `beacon_kit.statedb.partial_withdrawal_request_invalid`: When the validator's partial withdrawal request doesn't go through because the validators is _not_ partially withdrawable. Mainly for the case when a validator does multiple partial withdrawals in a row, resulting in partial withdrawals that cumulatively add up to more than their balance.

prs.title: feat(entropy): More ergonomic v2 interface
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Add a set of `requestV2` methods that give callers optionality on specifying providers etc. I think we get a set of questions like "what's a provider" or "what's userRandomNumber" which originate from the confusing function signatures in the user interface.

I'm not sure why we didn't do this in the first place -- i think for some reason we thought we couldn't override method names

prs.title: fix(pulse): validate freshness using the latest timestamp in the update data
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Validate the freshness of the updateData in `updatePriceFeeds` ourselves using the latest timestamp in the provided updates, rather than using `Pyth.parsePriceFeedUpdatesWithSlots`'s `minValidTime` parameter.

## Rationale

The Pyth contract's parse function enforces the minValidTime against all passed in feed updates. However, some of these may be from markets that are closed. T

commits.message: fix: validate min ts using highest ts in the update data

prs.title: fix(pulse): remove priceIds parameter from updatePriceFeeds
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Remove unnecessary `priceIds` parameter from `updatePriceFeeds`

## Rationale
The `updatePriceFeeds` function takes updateData and priceIds from the Keeper, and verifies that the provided priceIds match the subscription’s priceIds. However, this isn't necessary as we can use the subscription param's priceIds list, and the  the `Pyth.parsePriceFeedUpdatesWithSlots` call validates t

prs.title: refactor(argus): remove fortuna/entropy functionality
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

The big chop 🪓 
Remove Fortuna functionality from Argus

## Rationale

Argus was copy/pasted from Fortuna, which was designed for Entropy's commit/reveal flow. This is largely different from Argus's new role as Pulse's keeper, so this PR resets the project to a clean slate (save the boilerplate,) upon which we can implement the new pusher service.

prs.title: Update xdrgen to get iter_mut to VecM
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Update xdrgen to latest version.

### Why
Enables mutable iteration over VecM collections, simplifying code that needs to modify elements in place.

Close stellar/xdrgen#209

Dependent on:
- stellar/xdrgen#210

commits.message: update xdrgen version and add iter_mut to VecM

prs.title: Remove 'Waiting for transaction input' message when reading from stdin
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Remove the 'Waiting for transaction input' message when reading from stdin.

### Why
The message creates noise, especially when chaining many tx commands together, it ends up outputting several times. Due to the way that commands run concurrently when piping, the messages come out immediately all at once too with no context on what is waiting for what.

commits.message: remove stdin info message when reading from stdin

prs.title: Remove limit on QUERY_SNAPSHOT_LEDGERS
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Remove the max value limit on QUERY_SNAPSHOT_LEDGERS configuration parameter.

### Why
Allows operators to configure more than 10 ledgers for query snapshots if needed. 10 ledgers is arbitrarily low and larger numbers are usable.

Close #4682

commits.message: remove limit on query snapshot ledgers

prs.title: Remove redundant loads from checkValid path
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This change refactor transaction and operation `checkValid` to reduce the number of redundant loads. Initially, TransactionFrame cached source accounts, making loads cheap. This resulted in calling load 3-4 times during check valid. However, that cache has been removed, resulting in reading from disk 3-4 times per call to checkValid.

# Checklist
- [x] Reviewed the [contributin

prs.title: More fixes to fee bump tx tests.
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

More fixes to fee bump tx tests.

The apply tests were doing something really weird: they used the result generated by `checkValidForTesting` and then proceeded to `apply`. This is not a flow that actually exists in Core - `apply` always uses the result provided by `processFeeSeqNum` and `checkValid` is completely separate from the apply flow. This issue resulted in observing th

commits.message:
More fixes to fee bump tx tests.

The apply tests were doing something really weird: they used the result generated by `checkValidForTesting` and then proceeded to `apply`. This is not a flow that actually exists in Core - `apply` always uses the result provided by `processFeeSeqNum` and `checkValid` is completely separate from the apply flow. This issue resulted in observing the inner fee charged as 0 and not the inner tx fee charged, i.e. it hid the fact that we always set `feeCharged` in the inner result of fee bump txs.

Also updated the whole test to not use `checkValidForTesting` and removed an unnecessary argument from the event manager interface.

Currently, if you try calling `json.Marshal()` and `json.Unmarshal()` on a field of type `ExporterType`, this will fail as, when unmarshaling, it will try to convert a string (e.g. `"grpc"`, `"http"`, `"unknown"`) into a byte.

This is solved by adding a useful default value to the type and implementing `UnmarshalJSON`.

prs.title: Add example demonstrating how to communicate with specific nodes
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds a new example that demonstrates three different approaches to communicate with specific nodes in the Hedera network:
1. Direct node specification - Creating a custom network map with only specific nodes
2. Extracting from network map - Getting the full network and then extracting specific nodes
3. Using TLS with specific nodes - Demonstrating secure communication with specific node

commits.message:
This commit adds a new example (SpecificNodeExample.java) that demonstrates
three different approaches to communicate with specific nodes in the Hedera network:

1. Direct node specification - Creating a custom network map with only specific nodes
2. Extracting from network map - Getting the full network and then extracting specific nodes
3. Using TLS with specific nodes - Demonstrating secure communication with specific nodes

The example includes detailed documentation comments explaining each approach
and when to use them. This addresses issue #1594 which requested clearer
documentation on how to communicate with specific nodes.

prs.title: Mob-1442: Add support for text records
prs.truncated_body:
This changes includes the complete stack to handle textRecords
- New Name Service contract
- New API to manage the ENS registration
- Indexer mapping for  text records

commits.message: feat: Add name resolution endpoint for CNS and L1 domains
feat: Modify ENS mapping to append .clk.eth suffix
feat: Add HttpError custom error class for HTTP status handling and modular validation for firebase
feat: Implement L2 name registration and message generation endpoints with enhanced validation
feat: added error handler for new endpoints
feat: Add buildTypedData function to generate hash of typed messages

Implement text records in ClickNameService and associated tests

* Add mapping for text records in ClickNameService.
* Implement functions to set and get text records.
* Emit events when setting text records.
* Add tests to verify the functionality of text records, including authorization and expiration.

* Added AbiCoder import in helpers.ts.
* Introduced new constants for commit ABI and stored batch in interfaces.ts.
* Improved parseCommitTransaction function to handle transaction errors not found.
* Added validations for the “sender” parameter in the /storageProof path in index.ts.
* Removed unnecessary whitespace in several functions.
Updated .gitignore file to include sa.json. Added additional resources section in README.md with links to L1 contracts and ZK stack addresses. Updated .dockerignore to reflect change in .gitignore.
ClickResolver: rename constants, add storage slots for addresses/text, improve resolution logic and storage proof verification
Improve decoding and storage proof handling in "/storageProof": add safeUtf8Decode, enhance long string support, update imports and error handling
Add name deletion handling to ClickNameService: emit NameDeleted event and clean up text records on burn
Add text record support to IClickNameService: implement setTextRecord and getTextRecord with docs

Restore ClickNameService and IClickNameService. The setTextRecord and getTextRecord functions and related events and mappings are removed. Instead a new INameService contract is introduced and NameService is implemented, which includes name registration and expiration management functionality.

Add name service deployment and unit tests. Created deploy_name_service.dp.ts file to handle NameService contract deployment and added NameService.t.sol file for tests that verify registration and text record management, including name authorization and expiration cases.

Refactor signature validation and typed data construction in helpers.ts. The verifyMessage function is replaced by verifyTypedData and the validateSignature signature is updated to accept typedData. Modified buildTypedData to include a domain object and specific types. In addition, the data handling in index.ts is adjusted to reflect these changes, including additional validations for email.

deploy_nodl_name_service.dp.ts to handle the implementation of the NameService contract. Added logic for contract verification and introduced a control variable for deployment. Error handling during contract verification is improved.

Refactored the naming service: renamed variables and functions to improve clarity and consistency. Removed the CLICK_NAME_SERVICE_INTERFACE dependency, replacing it with NAME_SERVICE_INTERFACE. Domain name validations were adjusted and a new function buildZyfiRegisterRequest was implemented to simplify the creation of registration requests. In addition, the addresses of name service contracts in setup.ts were updated.
Update the registration logic in index.ts to break the name into two parts: name and subdomain. Modifies the buildZyfiRegisterRequest function to accept name and subdomain as parameters

Implemented new paths for name service in names.ts. Added endpoints to register names, set text records and resolve names. Improved the buildTypedData function to accept custom types and implemented the buildZyfiSetTextRecordRequest function. Additional validations are performed for input data and error handling logic is adjusted.

Added ENS text record handling in the name service. Implemented handleENSTextRecord function to handle TextRecordSet events, and updated schema and ABI files to include new types and related events. Modifications were made to the mapping files to integrate text record logic and improved the data structure in the project.

Updates the environment configuration and docker-compose file to include new contract addresses. CLICK_NS_ADDR and NODLE_NS_ADDR variables are added to .env.example and used in docker-compose.yml. In addition, the testnet-complete.ts file is modified to reflect the new contract addresses and the validation in ens.ts is adjusted to verify the existence of the new environment variables.

Updated the validation of contract addresses in ens.ts. Defined CLICK_NS_ADDR and NODLE_NS_ADDR constants with default values and adjusted the verification logic to use these constants instead of environment variables directly.
